person.title: PhD Student in Artificial Intelligence
person.subtitle: Focusing on neuro-symbolic interpretability, GNNs, and geometric deep learning
person.description: Exploring the intersection of deep learning, structured knowledge, mechanistic interpretability, and symbolic approaches to extraction of understandable concepts from AI systems. Studying responsible approaches to AI development.
about: I am a PhD student at the Intelligent Data Analysis Lab, Faculty of Electrical Engineering at the Czech Technical University in Prague, supervised by Gustav Šír. My research focuses on neuro-symbolic interpretability, graph neural networks, and geometric deep learning, all aimed at creating more trustworthy AI systems. Previously, I studied the expressivity of GNNs, as well as symmetry-invariant deep learning.

I am passionate about developing AI in a more responsible way. At our department, we've started an initiative organizing talks and discussions on Responsible AI, covering topics from AI ethics and fairness to AI safety and alignment. Recently, we also began our own research agenda, tackling the problem of evaluating explainable AI techniques from human and regulatory perspectives.
Beyond research, I also develop practical AI solutions, including those based on LLMs (RAG, agents, evals) and classical machine learning algorithms.

In 2024, I received a master's degree in artificial intelligence from the Czech Technical University. In 2021, I graduated from the prg.ai Minor program, completing interdisciplinary AI courses across Prague universities. I am currently serving as the president of the Czech Alpha Chapter of Upsilon Pi Epsilon (UPE).
